articles.headline: Obama Signals a Shift From Military Might to Diplomacy
articles.snippet: The announcements of an interim nuclear deal with Iran and a conference on Syria’s civil war were vivid statements that diplomacy has again become the centerpiece of American foreign policy.
articles.abstract: The announcements of an interim nuclear deal with Iran and a conference on Syria’s civil war were vivid statements that diplomacy has again become the centerpiece of American foreign policy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The weekend ended with the first tangible sign of a nuclear deal with Iran, after more than three decades of hostility. Then on Monday came the announcement that a conference will convene in January to try to broker an end to the civil war in Syria.

articles.headline: A Succession at Walmart Puts an Insider at the Helm
articles.snippet: C. Douglas McMillon, a longtime company executive who is now president of Walmart International, will succeed Michael T. Duke, who has been Walmart’s chief since 2009, the company said.
articles.abstract: C. Douglas McMillon, a longtime company executive who is now president of Walmart International, will succeed Michael T. Duke, who has been Walmart’s chief since 2009, the company said.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Walmart enters a fiercely competitive holiday season while still hampered by sluggish sales, the company’s board announced on Monday that Michael T. Duke, its chief executive, would retire early next year and a longtime executive, C. Douglas McMillon, would replace him.

articles.headline: Oil Prices Dip on Iran Deal, but Exports May Not Rise
articles.snippet: Easing tensions with Tehran could bring more of its oil and natural gas to global markets, but analysts didn’t see much change in market fundamentals.
articles.abstract: Easing tensions with Tehran could bring more of its oil and natural gas to global markets, but analysts didn’t see much change in market fundamentals.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Oil prices dipped and stocks around the world rose on Monday after the news of an agreement to temporarily freeze Iran’s nuclear program, but few specialists expected any significant change to consumer energy prices, at least in the short term.

articles.headline: Render Unto Caesar, but Who Backs Bitcoin?
articles.snippet: Many people are talking about bitcoin, but how practical is it to use it?
articles.abstract: Many people are talking about bitcoin, but how practical is it to use it?
articles.lead_paragraph: How can bitcoin be anything but a passing fad?

articles.headline: A Debate Over Paying Board Nominees of Activist Funds
articles.snippet: The dispute around director compensation is the latest front in the war of influence between activist hedge funds and corporate boards.
articles.abstract: The dispute around director compensation is the latest front in the war of influence between activist hedge funds and corporate boards.
articles.lead_paragraph: When executives serve on a company’s board, they are often handsomely compensated.

articles.headline: Frustration From a Deal on Flawed Hip Implants
articles.snippet: Some patients say the real winners in the $2.5 billion settlement are Johnson & Johnson and the plaintiffs’ lawyers, who will get about a third of the money.
articles.abstract: Some patients say the real winners in the $2.5 billion settlement are Johnson & Johnson and the plaintiffs’ lawyers, who will get about a third of the money.
articles.lead_paragraph: Patients injured by a flawed hip implant sold by Johnson & Johnson have directed their anger at myriad places over the years. The regulatory system that allowed the product’s sale. The company that repeatedly denied problems with the device. Even the doctors who implanted the hips.

articles.headline: N.S.A. May Have Hit Internet Companies at a Weak Spot
articles.snippet: Security experts said they believe that government spies bypassed Google and Yahoo and targeted the fiber-optic cables that connect their data centers.
articles.abstract: Security experts said they believe that government spies bypassed Google and Yahoo and targeted the fiber-optic cables that connect their data centers.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The recent revelation that the National Security Agency was able to eavesdrop on the communications of Google and Yahoo users without breaking into either company’s data centers sounded like something pulled from a Robert Ludlum spy thriller.
articles.byline: By Nicole Perlroth and John Markoff

articles.headline: New Pitch for Health Initiative: Mind Your Mom. Get Insured.
articles.snippet: To encourage enrollment by the young Americans who are crucial to the success of the Affordable Care Act, insurers are appealing to their primary health care advisers: their mothers.
articles.abstract: To encourage enrollment by the young Americans who are crucial to the success of the Affordable Care Act, insurers are appealing to their primary health care advisers: their mothers.
articles.lead_paragraph: As the Obama administration’s health overhaul sputters in its opening weeks, insurers and advocacy groups are pursuing a new strategy in the quest to get millions of young people to sign up for health insurance: They’re appealing to their mothers.

articles.headline: As Homeless Line Up for Food, Los Angeles Weighs Restrictions
articles.snippet: Facing an uproar from homeowners in a county that has one of the worst homeless problems in the nation, two members of the City Council have called for the city to ban the feeding of homeless people in public spaces.
articles.abstract: Facing an uproar from homeowners in a county that has one of the worst homeless problems in the nation, two members of the City Council have called for the city to ban the feeding of homeless people in public spaces.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — They began showing up at dusk last week, wandering the streets, slumped in wheelchairs and sitting on sidewalks, paper plates perched on their knees. By 6:30 p.m., more than 100 homeless people had lined up at a barren corner in Hollywood, drawn by free meals handed out from the back of a truck every night by volunteers.

articles.headline: U.S. and Saudis in Growing Rift as Power Shifts
articles.snippet: Although Saudi Arabia remains a close American ally, the nuclear accord with Iran is the culmination of a slow mutual disenchantment that began at the end of the Cold War.
articles.abstract: Although Saudi Arabia remains a close American ally, the nuclear accord with Iran is the culmination of a slow mutual disenchantment that began at the end of the Cold War.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — There was a time when Saudi and American interests in the Middle East seemed so aligned that the cigar-smoking former Saudi ambassador, Prince Bandar bin Sultan, was viewed as one of the most influential diplomats in Washington.

articles.headline: Once Suitor, Jos. A. Bank Is a Target for Men’s Wearhouse
articles.snippet: In a strategy that harks back to the Pac-Man defense, Men’s Wearhouse bid $55 a share in cash to acquire its one-time suitor.
articles.abstract: In a strategy that harks back to the Pac-Man defense, Men’s Wearhouse bid $55 a share in cash to acquire its one-time suitor.
articles.lead_paragraph: Updated, 8:20 p.m. | Men’s Wearhouse didn’t like the feeling of being up for sale.
